data.meta_description: Let me start this off by listing the kind of women I pursued in the past: . Smokin' body and all around hottie . Large bank account or able to sponge off rich parents . Willing to lend (without actually expecting payback) large amounts of cash . Generous (read: likely to shower me with expensive…
data.text:
Let me start this off by listing the kind of women I pursued in the past:

. Smokin' body and all around hottie

. Large bank account or able to sponge off rich parents

. Willing to lend (without actually expecting payback) large amounts of cash

. Generous (read: likely to shower me with expensive gifts)

. Loves to party (after a few drinks we can rent a room at the Palace Hotel, charged to your credit card)

. Loyal (will defend me to those that say I'm a sleazy opportunist)

Jen was that complete package. At first it was lust, which turned to love. Not sure how that happened. I realized that she was more than a meal ticket. I started to view the world in a different way. After Jen's death, I had to take a look at myself and reflect on the past. I want to change. This means that I will eventually have to move on.

So, when I'm ready to open my heart again, this is what I'd look for in a romantic partner:

. Someone who doesn't know about my past or will not judge me for it

. A sense of humor (willing to be silly, laugh and goof off)

. Age is not a factor. Anywhere between 18 to 40-something would be okay.

. Attractive (Hey, there has to be chemistry!)

. Adventurous

. Beautiful smile

. Kindness

. Able to accept me for who I am, as well as my strange family

There's really no definitive list, however. I'd be content to meet someone who can make me smile and forget about the past for a while.

Crossposted to: theatrical_muse

*smirk*
